page.title: 13The Priory Now
page.content: The priory, 1 mile away from the village of Mattersey is in the care of the Ministry of Works. It is in ruins but it has kept well. The grassland and the old stone walls are well cared for. There are three arches still intact and one arch door in the small church. There is a small kitchen with a serving hatch. The cloisters are not very large and there is a small pillar in a wall. The wall has protected it from the wind and bad weather. Where there are no walls left, there are neatly kept paths which show where the walls should be. the river flows along the north eastern edge of the priory. There are still some old steps going up to a different level. The church still has some sort of tower. On the nothern edge of the perimiter fence there is an old farmhouse built with stones from the priory.
